author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Returns an EWS query according to the automation's arguments.
automation.name: BuildEWSQuery

automation.description: Get emails from multiple folders of an account all at once.
automation.name: GetEWSFolder

automation.description: Creates a public key (.cer file), a private key (.pfx) file, and a Base64 encoded private key to use to authenticate the EWS Extension Online Powershell v2 integration.
automation.name: CreateCertificate

classifier.description: Maps incoming EWS phishing email message fields.
classifier.name: EWS - Incoming Mapper

commands.description: Retrieves the actual attachments from an item (email message). To get all attachments for a message, only specify the item-id argument.
commands.name: ews-get-attachment

commands.description: Deletes the attachments of an item (email message).
commands.name: ews-delete-attachment

commands.description: Returns a list of searchable mailboxes. This command requires eDiscovery permissions to the Exchange Server. For more information, see the EWSv2 integration documentation.
commands.name: ews-get-searchable-mailboxes

commands.description: Searches over multiple mailboxes or all Exchange mailboxes. Use either the mailbox-search-scope command or the email-addresses command to search specific mailboxes. This command requires eDiscovery permissions to the Exchange Server. For more information, see the EWS v2 integration documentation.
commands.name: ews-search-mailboxes

commands.description: Move an item to different folder in the mailbox.
commands.name: ews-move-item

commands.description: Delete items from mailbox.
commands.name: ews-delete-items

commands.description: Searches for items in the specified mailbox. Specific permissions are needed for this operation to search in a target mailbox other than the default.
commands.name: ews-search-mailbox

commands.description: Retrieves contacts for a specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-get-contacts

commands.description: Retrieves the out-of-office status for a specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-get-out-of-office

commands.description: Recovers messages that were soft-deleted.
commands.name: ews-recover-messages

commands.description: Creates a new folder in a specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-create-folder

commands.description: Marks an item as junk. This is commonly used to block an email address. For more information, see the Microsoft documentation: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/dn481311(v=exchg.150).aspx
commands.name: ews-mark-item-as-junk

commands.description: Retrieves information for folders for a specified mailbox. Only folders with read permissions will be returned. Your visual folders on the mailbox, such as "Inbox", are under the folder "Top of Information Store".
commands.name: ews-find-folders

commands.description: Retrieves items from a specified folder in a mailbox. The items are order by the item created time, most recent is first.
commands.name: ews-get-items-from-folder

commands.description: Retrieves items by item ID.
commands.name: ews-get-items

commands.description: Moves an item from one mailbox to different mailbox.
commands.name: ews-move-item-between-mailboxes

commands.description: Retrieves a single folder.
commands.name: ews-get-folder

commands.description: Starts a compliance search.
commands.name: ews-o365-start-compliance-search

commands.description: Returns the status and results of a compliance search.
commands.name: ews-o365-get-compliance-search

commands.description: Purges the results found in the compliance search.
commands.name: ews-o365-purge-compliance-search-results

commands.description: Removes the compliance search.
commands.name: ews-o365-remove-compliance-search

commands.description: Checks the status of the purge operation on the compliance search.
commands.name: ews-o365-get-compliance-search-purge-status

commands.description: Returns the auto-discovery information. Can be used to manually configure the Exchange Server.
commands.name: ews-get-autodiscovery-config

commands.description: Expands a distribution list to display all members. By default, expands only first layer of the distribution list. If recursive-expansion is "True", the command expands nested distribution lists and returns all members.
commands.name: ews-expand-group

commands.description: Marks items as read or unread.
commands.name: ews-mark-items-as-read

commands.description: Retrieves items by item ID and uploads it's content as eml file.
commands.name: ews-get-items-as-eml

commands.description: Starts the OAuth2.0 authorization process.
commands.name: ews-auth-start

commands.description: Completes the OAuth2.0 authorization process.
commands.name: ews-auth-complete

commands.description: Tests the OAuth2.0 authorization process.
commands.name: ews-auth-test

commands.description: Gets junk rules for the specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-junk-rules-get

commands.description: Sets junk rules for the specified mailbox.
commands.name: ews-junk-rules-set

commands.description: Sets junk rules in all managed accounts.
commands.name: ews-global-junk-rules-set

commands.description:
Searches message data for the last 10 days. If you run this command without any arguments, only data from the last 48 hours is returned.
If you enter a start date that is older than 10 days, you will receive an error and the command will return no results.
This command returns a maximum of 1,000,000 results, and will timeout on very large queries. If your query returns too many results, consider splitting it up using shorter start_date and end_date intervals.
commands.name: ews-message-trace-get

commands.description: Displays the federation trust configured for the Exchange organization.
commands.name: ews-federation-trust-get

commands.description: Retrieves the Exchange organization's federated organization identifier and related details, such as federated domains, organization contact, and status.
commands.name: ews-federation-configuration-get

commands.description: Gets the configuration information for the remote domains configured in your organization. This command is available only in the Exchange Online PowerShell V2 module.
commands.name: ews-remote-domain-get

commands.description: Displays the existing user objects in your organization.
commands.name: ews-user-list

commands.description: Retrieves information about the AuditBypassEnabled property value for user accounts (on-premises Exchange and the cloud) and computer accounts (on-premises Exchange only).
commands.name: ews-mailbox-audit-bypass-association-list

integration.description: This integration enables you to manage and interact with Microsoft O365 - Exchange Online from within XSOAR.
integration.name: O365 - EWS - Extension

commands.description: Displays mailbox objects and attributes, populate property pages, or supplies mailbox information to other tasks.
commands.name: ews-mailbox-list

commands.name: ews-cas-mailbox-list

commands.name: ews-mailbox-permission-list

commands.description: Displays information about SendAs permissions that are configured for users.
commands.name: ews-recipient-permission-list

commands.description: Displays existing recipient objects in your organization. This command returns all mail-enabled objects (for example, mailboxes, mail users, mail contacts, and distribution groups).
commands.name: ews-recipient-list

commands.description: Add new items to the Tenant Allow/Block Lists.  Uses PowerShell New-TenantAllowBlockListItems cmdlet.
commands.name: ews-new-tenant-allow-block-list-items

commands.description: Retrieve current Tenant Allow/Block List items.  Uses Get-TenantAllowBlockListItems cmdlet.
commands.name: ews-get-tenant-allow-block-list-items

commands.description: Retrieve current count of defined Tenant Allow/Block List items.  Uses Get-TenantAllowBlockListItems cmdlet.
commands.name: ews-get-tenant-allow-block-list-count

commands.description: Remove items from the Tenant Allow/Block Lists.   You can delete items by their value or by unique ID.  Uses PowerShell cmdlet Remove-TenantAllowBlockListItems cmdlet.
commands.name: ews-remove-tenant-allow-block-list-items

integration.description: Use the EWS Extension Online Powershell v2 integration to get information about mailboxes and users in your organization.  This integration can also retrieve and modify Tenant Allow/Block Lists.
integration.name: EWS Extension Online Powershell v2

integration.description: The new EWS O365 integration uses OAuth 2.0 protocol and can be used with Exchange Online and Office 365 (mail).
integration.name: EWS O365

commands.description: OAuth2.0 - Start authorization.
commands.name: o365-sc-auth-start

commands.description: OAuth2.0 - Complete authorization.
commands.name: o365-sc-auth-complete

commands.description: OAuth2.0 - Test authorization.
commands.name: o365-sc-auth-test

commands.description: Create compliance search in the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-new-search

commands.description: Modifies non-running compliance searches in the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-set-search

commands.description: Remove compliance search by name from the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-remove-search

commands.description: List compliance searches in the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-list-search

commands.description: Gets compliance search by name from the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-get-search

commands.description: Starts stopped, completed, or not started compliance search in the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-start-search

commands.description: Stop running compliance search in the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-stop-search

commands.description: After you create a content search using the o365-sc-new-search command and run it using the o365-sc-start-search command, you assign a search action to the search using the o365-sc-new-search-action command.
commands.name: o365-sc-new-search-action

commands.description: Removes a compliance search action by searching for the action name in the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-remove-search-action

commands.description: Lists compliance search actions from the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-list-search-action

commands.description: Gets compliance search action from the Security & Compliance Center.
commands.name: o365-sc-get-search-action

integration.description: This integration allows you to manage and interact with Microsoft security and compliance content search.
integration.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Content Search

playbook.description:
This playbook perform:
1. Creates a new compliance search action - Preview (Base on created compliance search).
2. Waits for the preview action to complete.
3. Retrieves the preview results.
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search Action - Preview

playbook.description:
This playbook performs the following steps:
1. Creates a new compliance search action Purge - Hard or Soft.
2. Waits for the compliance search action to complete.
3. Retrieves the delete search action.
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search Action - Delete

playbook.description: This playbook searches EWS to identify and delete emails with similar attributes of a malicious email.
playbook.name: Search And Delete Emails - EWS

playbook.description:
This playbook performs the following steps:
1. Creates a compliance search.
2. Starts a compliance search.
3. Waits for the compliance search to complete.
4. Gets the results of the compliance search.
5. Gets the preview results, if specified.
6. Deletes the search results (Hard/Soft).
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search And Delete

playbook.description: Get emails from specific folders and pre-process them using EWS.
playbook.name: Get Mails By Folder Paths

playbook.description:
This v2 playbook retrieves the original email in a thread as an EML file (and not an email object as in the previous version) by using the EWS v2 or EWSO365 integration.
It also reduces the number of tasks to perform the fetch action.
Note: You must have the necessary eDiscovery permissions in the EWS integration to execute a global search.
playbook.name: Get Original Email - EWS v2

playbook.description:
This playbook performs the following steps:
1. Creates a compliance search.
2. Starts a compliance search.
3. Waits for the compliance search to complete.
4. Gets the results of the compliance search as an output.
5. Gets the preview results, if specified.
playbook.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Search

playbook.description: Run a ComplianceSearch on Office 365 and delete the results.
playbook.name: Office 365 Search and Delete

integrations.name: O365 - Security And Compliance - Content Search

name: EWS
readme:
Exchange Web Services (EWS) provides the functionality to enable client applications to communicate with the Exchange server. EWS provides access to much of the same data that is made available through Microsoft Office Outlook.


## What does this pack do?

- Monitor a specific email account and create incidents from incoming emails to the defined folder.
- Search for an email message across mailboxes and folders.
- Get email attachment information.
- Delete email items from a mailbox.
- Manage Tenant Allow/Block Lists.

## Integrations
The [EWS O365 integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ewso365) enables you to:
- Retrieve information on emails and activities in a target mailbox.
- Perform operations on the target mailbox such as deleting emails and attachments or moving emails from folder to folder.

The [EWS v2 integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ews-v2) enables you to:
- Run compliance search commands as part of Office 365 to search for an email message across mailboxes and folders.
- Retrieve information on emails and activities in a target mailbox.
- Perform operations on the target mailbox such as deleting emails and attachments or moving emails from folder to folder. 

The [O365 - EWS - Extension integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ews-extension) enables you to manage and interact with Microsoft O365 - Exchange Online from within XSOAR
- Get junk rules for a specified mailbox.
- Set junk rules for a specified mailbox.
- Set junk rules for all managed accounts.
- Search message data.
The [EWS Extension Online Powershell v2 integration](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/ews-extension-online-powershell-v2) enables you to retrieve information about mailboxes and users in your organization.
- Display client access settings that are configured on mailboxes.
- Display mailbox objects and attributes, populate property pages, or supply mailbox information to other tasks.
- Retrieve permissions on a mailbox.
- Display information about SendAs permissions that are configured for users.
- Display existing recipient objects in your organization such as mailboxes, mail users, mail contacts, and distribution groups.
- Add, remove, list, and count entries in Tenant Allow/Block Lists.

## EWS Permissions
To perform actions on mailboxes of other users, and to execute searches on the Exchange server, you need specific permissions. 

| Permission |Use Case |
| ----- | ----|
| Delegate | One-to-one relationship between users. |
| Impersonation	| A single account needs to access multiple mailboxes. |
| eDiscovery | Search the Exchange server. |	
| Compliance Search | Perform searches across mailboxes and get an estimate of the results. |
### Pack Contributors:

---
 - Mike Rizzo

Contributions are welcome and appreciated. For more info, visit our [Contribution Guide](https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/contributing/contributing).
